reviewText: If you want an easy-to-follow, no nonsense video to get you started, then this one is fine. The video quality isn't the prettiest and the style is dated. There isn't much talk about contraindications: there are the "do's" but not much on the "do nots." There isn't anything about special considerations, but I got this video along with the "Real Bodywork" video that is very comprehensive to the point of being a little intimidating, so the two together turned out to be a good combination.

this dvd was a total waste of my dollars; as a massage practitioner, I wanted some added insight into a modality I ALREADY do on a regular basis.  This dvd wasn't fit for home viewing and was...yucky.

Bought a few DVDs but should have looked for the combo set

I bout some of this company's DVDs, then rented the rest on video on demand.  Its good stuff just wish I would have fully reseatched thier products to find the combination sets they offered.  I'd recommend the DVDs for anyone wanting to learn about massage.

This dvd is bad quality, most of the time you can see only his back (camera is positioned on one spot) and cant see his hands or massage, I wish I didn't spent money on this because it not good to practice.
This is a great gift for a baby shower. I bought this video as part of a gift box. contained a bunch of fun things and a this dvd that will help baby and mommy.

As a massage therapist in a large massage center, I seldom have pregnant massage clients because there are other staff who are booked with them first.
I was glad to get this video for the techniques. I will look into purchasing the first volume.
I would have liked the camera to have been in some better positions to zoom in on technique.
